qas.question: In what type of settlement did most Jews live?
In what centuries did a Jewish community develop in England?
What religion were Spanish Jews pressured into converting to?
In what part of Europe did the Slavs live?
What was the religion of the Slavs?

context: Jews also spread across Europe during the period. Communities were established in Germany and England in <a1_0>the 11th and 12th<a1_0/> centuries, but Spanish Jews, long settled in Spain under the Muslims, came under Christian rule and increasing pressure to convert to <a2_0>Christianity<a2_0/>. Most Jews were confined to the <a0_0>cities<a0_0/>, as they were not allowed to own land or be peasants.[U] Besides the Jews, there were other non-Christians on the edges of Europe—<a4_0>pagan<a4_0/> Slavs in <a3_0>Eastern<a3_0/> Europe and Muslims in Southern Europe.
